definitions: A continuous deep, resonant sound, typically one that is unsettling.
A street fight, especially one between rival gangs.
A low, continuous, and indistinct sound of distant thunder or traffic.
A seat at the back of a carriage or car, typically an open one.
examples: The rumble of thunder grew louder.
There was a rumble between the two gangs last night.
He heard the rumble of the subway train.
She sat in the rumble seat of the antique car.
